heading: 1.1 Simple bar plot
code:
p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(x = class, color = class, fill = class)) +
  geom_bar(alpha = .75) +
  scale_color_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) +
  scale_fill_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) +
  theme_rethink()

ggplotly(p, tooltip = "x")

heading: 2.1 Simple line plot
code:
p <- ggplot(economics, aes(x = date, y = unemploy)) + 
  geom_line() +
  theme_rethink()

ggplotly(p)

heading: 2.2 Multiple lines plot
code:
p <- ggplot(economics_long, aes(x = date, y = value01, 
    color = variable)) +
  geom_line() +
  scale_color_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) +
  theme_rethink()

ggplotly(p)

heading: 3.1 Simple scatter plot
code:
p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) +
  geom_point(alpha = .85) +
  theme_rethink()

ggplotly(p)

heading: 3.2 Multiple scatter plot
code:
p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = factor(cyl))) +
  geom_point(alpha = .85) +
  scale_color_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) +
  theme_rethink()

ggplotly(p)

heading: 4.1 Availability of different point styles
text: Multiple different styles point available using ‘shape =’ command, followed number desired shape. Note different shapes /allow color fill, also ggplot ggplotly display shapes slightly differently.
code:
point_styles <- tibble(point.style = seq(0, 25),
                       x = c(rep(seq(0, 9), 2), seq(0, 5)),
                       y = c(rep(0, 10), rep(1, 10), rep(2, 6)),
                       label = c(rep("0-9", 10), rep("10-19", 10), rep("20-25", 6))
)

point_styles <-
  point_styles %>% 
  mutate(label = fct_relevel(label, "0-9" , "10-19" , "20-25"))
p <- ggplot(data = point_styles) +
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0 , 9), breaks = seq(from = 0, to = 9, by = 1)) +
  geom_point(aes(x = x, y = label), size = 5, shape = point_styles$point.style, color = "Black", fill = "#7ccbbc") +
  theme_rethink()

ggplotly(p)
p
